summary:
Welsh is a Celtic language spoken mainly in Wales and by some in England and Argentina. It's also known as Cymraeg or y Gymraeg. In 2011, the Welsh language gained official status in Wales, and it's the only official language in the UK outside of English.

Around 17.8% of Wales' population can speak Welsh, with almost half considering themselves fluent. The Welsh government aims to increase speakers to one million by 2050. Despite its minority status, Welsh is considered less endangered than other Celtic languages.
title: Welsh language
